frame.name: Commutative_statement
frame.definition:
<def-root>LUs in this frame describe a stative relationship between two numbers,<fen>Term1</fen> and <fen>Term2</fen> or, collectively, <fen>Terms</fen>, via a commutative arithmetic operation. The numbers are specifically expressed, along with the Result of the operation.
<ex>The <t>sum</t> of <fex name="Terms">two and three</fex> is <fex name="Result">five</fex>.</ex> <ex>That's <fex name="Term1">three</fex> <t>times</t> <fex name="Term2">the amount I asked for</fex>!</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Result
FE.definition: <def-root>The number or role of a number that comes from the interaction of <fen>Term1</fen> and <fen>Term2</fen> via a commutative operation.</def-root>

FE.name: Term1
FE.definition: <def-root>The grammatically more prominent number involved in a commutative operation.</def-root>

FE.name: Term2
FE.definition: <def-root>The grammatically less prominent number involved in commutative operation.</def-root>

FE.name: Terms
FE.definition: <def-root>Two more or elements of a commutative arithmetic operation. This frame element may be represented as <fen>Term1</fen> and <fen>Term2</fen>.</def-root>

lexUnit.name: sum.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a number which results from addition

lexUnit.name: product.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a number that results from multiplication

lexUnit.name: times.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: multiples of an original quantity
